comment:
Constraint:In this context, constraints refer to the limitations or requirements that Mark must adhere to, such as the minimum acreage of potatoes and cucumbers he must grow.
Objective function:The objective function is the mathematical expression that represents the quantity to be optimized, in this case, Mark's profit from growing potatoes and cucumbers.
Optimization:Optimization involves finding the best solution from all feasible solutions, in this case, determining the optimal number of acres of potatoes and cucumbers for Mark to grow to maximize his profit.
